snippet: The Sangin district in Afghanistan offers a troubling portrait of life where the Taliban decide to make their mark and the Americans no longer fight.
abstract: Afghanistan's Sangin district in Helmand Province offers troubling portrait of life where Taliban decide to make their mark and Americans no longer fight; since launching an offensive there, Taliban have easily weathered halfhearted attempts by Afghan forces to reclaim Sangin, and coalition commanders are concerned that they may have to intervene for second time in area officially turned over to Afghan security control.

byline.contributor: Sharifullah Sahak contributed reporting from Kabul, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: The Sangin district in Afghanistan offers a troubling portrait of life where the Taliban decide to make their mark and the Americans no longer fight.

headline.main: Afghan Army Struggles in District Under Siege
headline.print_headline: Afghan Army Struggles in District Under Siege
